title: Ram Charan Learnt His Lessons From Mistakes? Read Why We Think He Is A Changed Man Now
text:
Posted by: Pravallika Anjuri Updated: Wednesday, October 21, 2015, 13:00 [IST] 
Looks like Ram Charan is in a process of self-introspection. Though he is often lauded for his maturity levels that are higher than his age by his close aides and industry insiders, for a fact Ram Charan carries an arrogant image among the public for the controversies he was involved in earlier. 
Apparently, the statements he has been making of late and the acts of the star in the recent past, are actually surprising the observers. He appears to have learnt quite a lot from the mistakes and the flops. 
Though Ram Charan had a dream run at the box office, he is in the net of criticism for the cliched roles and outdated scripts he opts for. However, the success of those films made everybody overlook the back lash. 
But, it seems like Charan have had a personal affect of the comments on him, though people ignored them. Going by his recent interviews, the actor is clear about where things have gone wrong with his films. 
Talking to a daily, Charan agreed that he is a changed person now and admitted that there were few mistakes from his side too because of his impulsive nature but stated it clear that most of the times he is dragged into controversies that are blown out of the proportion, giving Rudramadevi-Bruce Lee clash as an example. 
Nevertheless, Charan still maintained a point clear that he or his family members would be reacting aggressively if somebody tries to put his dad, Megastar Chiranjeevi down. At the same time, he opined that it is sometimes a waste, reacting on each issue because there would be a lot of things to react once they start answering everyone. 
Check out the slides below to read some of the shocking statements and acts of Ram Charan from the recent past, which made us think there is a visible change in the actor. Ram Charan Learnt His Lesson From Mistakes? 1/7 About Flops & Hits 
Ram Charan openly stated that he do not like some of his hit movies and opined that he already did a lot of commercial films. But the actor said to have a reason to do so, because he is the one responsible to safeguard mega fan base and do films in likes of fans. Ram Charan Learnt His Lesson From Mistakes? 2/7 Future Projects 
Ram Charan is in a process of reinventing himself after the mediocre run of Bruce Lee. He stated that he will only do films if they really excite him and not to protect his fan base. According to reports, he is in talks with Krish, Sukumar and Gautam Menon, for his next projects and all of them are known to be versatile story tellers. Ram Charan Learnt His Lesson From Mistakes? 3/7 Course In Script Writing 
The actor confessed that he is going to take classes in script writing that actually improve his taste of story selections and judgement. Now, which star would actually say that? Ram Charan Learnt His Lesson From Mistakes? 4/7 Appreciation 
It is rare to see stars being appreciative about other star hero films but Ram Charan is of late being the first person encourage any good attempt from the industry. Mahesh Babu, Rajamouli, Raj Tharun, Gautam Menon too have acknowledged Charan's sweet gestures. Ram Charan Learnt His Lesson From Mistakes? 5/7 Songs and Dances 
"People are not ready to accept films if you just there singing and dancing, they are accepting a film only that tells a genuine story." Charan stated in an interview after the release of Bruce Lee. Coincidentally, that was the remark most of the critics have on the film. Is he being close to realities? Ram Charan Learnt His Lesson From Mistakes? 6/7 Family 
When mega fans were in a confusion about the clash between Chiru and Pawan Kalyan, Ram Charan played a vital role in getting the brothers back and has made Megastar birthday celebrations an occasion for the stars to comeback to the good terms. You might like
